definition: wedge/peg/stopper/prologue (in some modern novels)/prologue or interlude in Yuan dynasty drama

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The milling machine was firmly chocked up.
sentences.chinese: 那台铣床用楔子稳固地支垫著。

sentences.english: Rectification of this fault is achieved by insertion of a wedge.
sentences.chinese: 嵌入一个楔子就可纠正误差。

sentences.english: Each of them can be individually jacked up, allowing wedges to be added underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他们每个都单独顶起，楔子加在下面。

sentences.english: He wedged the window to prevent it from rattling.
sentences.chinese: 他用楔子把窗户塞紧使它不作响。

sentences.english: Please wedge this cabinet to keep it from tipping.
sentences.chinese: 请在橱底楔入楔子以防它倾斜。

sentences.english: Chock the barrel up or else it will roll over.
sentences.chinese: 用楔子塞住圆桶，不然它会滚过去。

sentences.english: The body and wedge are malleable iron.
sentences.chinese: 线夹的本体和楔子为可锻铸铁，热镀锌。

sentences.english: Chock the back wheels when I stop .
sentences.chinese: 在我停下车时，把后轮用楔子塞住。

sentences.english: Once, a circle missed a wedge.
sentences.chinese: 从前，有一只圆圈缺了一块楔子。

sentences.english: The circle wanted to be whole, so it went around looking for its missing piece.
sentences.chinese: 它想保持完整，便四处寻找那块楔子。

sentences.english: Dantes reflected that he must attack his wedge .
sentences.chinese: 邓蒂斯知道他必须先进攻那块作为楔子的大石。

sentences.english: To start the split, drive either a hatchet or wedges into the corner end of the stave.
sentences.chinese: 开始劈开，用锤把斧头楔子从一头的锯口打进原木。

sentences.english: The head is wedge-shaped viewed from above and the side.
sentences.chinese: 从上方或侧面看，头部都呈楔子形。

sentences.english: Four rowing limbs, and one wedge-balancing head.
sentences.chinese: 划动的四肢，加上一颗楔子般用来平衡的脑袋。

sentences.english: The wheels of the truck were chocked by the driver.
sentences.chinese: 司机将卡车的车轮用楔子垫好。

definition: to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
to open an aperture/(extended meaning) to cut a way through/to open up a road
chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]
mortise (slot cut into wood to receive a tenon)
